file_content.text: Becoming Baras's apprentice was my destiny. Did I come this far and overcome such adversity, only to be proven unworthy?
I've waited a long time to put you in your place. Consider this--killing you was easy.
You were weak. [Kill Vemrin]
Then do it. Finish me!
Don't be so hard on yourself, Vemrin. You have been a worthy opponent.
You fought well.
Shut up! There is only victory or death.
I refuse to live a... lesser life. Finish me. I will not accept mercy.
Enough. [Kill Vemrin]
Hey, this is it. The secret entrance to the hidden cavern is in here. Just let me get my bearings.
Look out!
Klemral! How dare you interfere. This business is far beyond you.
He saved my life. I'm not going to let you stab him in the back.
I'd be dead if it wasn't for her. I'm not going to let you stab her in the back.
Well, well, Klemral, I'm impressed. You have more nerve than I gave you credit for.
What a pleasant surprise.
I'm surprising myself, too.
I have a surprise for you.
Thank you.
It's the least I could do.
No, the least you could do is die.
This is my problem.
Sorry, I just couldn't sit back.
And now it's time for you to lie down.
The fool must have spotted me following you. Too bad his warning will do you no good.
It ends now. Once I kill you, the slave girl will show me the forbidden cave, and I will claim the lightsaber and my rightful place as Lord Baras's apprentice.
Not a chance.
Please Vemrin, don't let it come to this. I will kill you if I have to.
Back down. Last chance.
Take your time, slave. Just have the entrance uncovered by the time I finish killing your new master.
Can't say I'm surprised to see you, Vemrin. You're remarkably predictable.
I was expecting this.
Oh good, we were getting lonely and now look who's decided to join the party--my old friend Vemrin.
Not you again.
You'll do nothing of the sort. Fitting that you meet your end in a tomb, Vemrin.
Time for you to die.
My passions run deeper than yours. I am the true essence of what it is to be Sith.
My legacy has suffered long enough. After today, you will be forgotten. It ends here and now.
Look who's here. I have nothing to say to you.
You're not supposed to be here. You haven't earned the right.
Somebody wandered where they don't belong.
Lord Baras has nothing to do with the likes of you.
Hey there, acolyte. Hold on a moment. Let me get a look at you.
Hmm. So you're Overseer Tremel's secret weapon, huh? Impressive, to be sure. Afraid the old man waited too long to make his move, though.
I don't have time for the likes of you. Explain yourself or get lost.
Don't bother me.
We give the orders around here.
That's a curious statement.
I'll tell you how--we just say so, and what we say is so.
You must be Vemrin.
I heard about you.
He's gonna be Lord Vemrin. Better get used to the idea.
Easy, Dolgis. No way to treat our new brother. He's right off the shuttle, still getting his bearings.
Easy, Dolgis. We should be civil with our new sister--at least until she's gotten her bearings.
I'm Vemrin, and unlike you I've fought and bled for everything I have. I demand respect.
Are you saying I haven't earned my way?
What are you implying?
Please. Everyone knows what Tremel is doing.
This is a big place, Vemrin. There's more than enough room here for both of us.
We can get along.
I'm glad to hear you say that. There's plenty of room for you behind me.
You don't want to make me angry, Vemrin.
Back off.
Believe it or not, I'm trying to keep you from getting killed.
If Overseer Tremel had made his move a year ago, when I first arrived, you might've had a chance. But now--too little, too late.
So overconfidence is your weak point. I'll make a note of it.
You're a cocky one.
So overconfidence is your weak point. Hmm... I'll make a note of it.
You're a cocky one.
Don't push me, child. I will put you in your place if I have to.
I have no idea what you're talking about, and I don't care.
Are we done here?
Then I'll explain it slowly and use small words.
It's never too late to kill a man.
What if you disappear?
Believe me, if it were allowed, you'd already be dead.
This is ridiculous, Vemrin. Let's just kill her and hide the body.
This is ridiculous, Vemrin. Let's just kill him and hide the body.
We're not on Balmorra anymore, Dolgis. There are rules. Traditions. We'll leave the shortcuts to Overseer Tremel and his last pathetic hope here.
My honor is not to be questioned.
Don't insult me.
We'll see about that. Coming, Dolgis?
Wow, you're unfriendly.
You're not funny. Just pathetic. And you've been warned. Coming, Dolgis?
I'm going to take what's yours and then I'm going to kill you.
Prepare to be crushed.
You have no idea the enemy you're making. Are you coming, Dolgis?
Be right there, Vemrin.
Listen to me, you useless priss. Acolytes aren't allowed to murder each other. But accidents happen. It isn't murder without witnesses.
No more warnings. Vemrin's the alpha monster here. You go after Vemrin, you die.
Wow, nice work.
Just find the forbidden cavern.
Back to business.
I already have. See?
Glad to impress you.
Thanks.
Speak when spoken to, slave.
I didn't ask. [Shock Vette]
Ow! Bantha poo! What was that for?
Just to put you in your place. So you don't forget your station.
A reminder.
Couldn't you have written a note? Sheesh.
My finger must have slipped.
Sorry, my mistake.
Well, stop dipping it in oil, will ya?
For losing your focus and slacking off.
You relaxed.
I haven't slacked off. Look.
The secret entrance is right here.
Uh, you're welcome!
Bite that tongue of yours, slave.
Keep the comments to yourself.
Consider it bitten.
It's nice to be acknowledged. Thanks.
Here's my thank you, slave. Choke on it.
Shut up. [Shock Vette]
Ah! Sorry, sorry!
Appreciate it.
